chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force
Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi K Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $180 to the Kings Corner Bar

Pay 10% restitution surcharge (see 'other' above)

Restitution will ge paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

No Contact with Ms. H. or the Kings Corner Bar
.

Write a letter of apology to victim(s)

Undergo any assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Complete any other conditions deemed appropriate by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
Can be served on Electronic Monitoring through Justice Support Services - sentence credit to be applied toward jail sentence
.

State by Kellis / Def w/ Atty Vincent Rust
JS VIOLATIONS
Rust:  def using mj to alleviate anxiety while on bond - she is living w/ her father.  She has set up counseling for drug/alcohol & mental health.
Kellis leaves it up to CRT but can't just sit back & watch violations pile up
CRT:  Def has cont'd to test, has set up appointments...those are positive things.  I was skeptical about releasing def from custody - even w/ violations, CRT is pleased to see def not back for reasons I thought you would be back for.  Continue w/ your efforts.  You are making progress but if you can't get it figured out, we will have to do something different w/ your bond

State by Keller /  Def in custody w/ Atty Vincent Rust
Rust:  I submitted a written Motion.  I spoke to Heidi's biological father, he will allow def to come & live w/ him.  He is unable to post any cash for her.  Def's father owns business, he said she can work for him there.  Def does not have criminal record, cooperated @ time of arrest..stable residence..not flight risk
Keller:  would not object to Sig bond but would want JS to check out residence first, make sure it is suitable.  Also no drugs  & testing w/ JS
CRT asks how def will get back & forth for CRT from Elroy?
Def;  family will help me
Rust:  I am hoping to set up something so def can test in area closer to home - def does agree to test
CRT:  $5000 Sig bond signed by def w/ conditions:  NO Weapons;  No alcohol;  No bars or taverns;  No Contact w/ the bar where this happened;  NO Contact w/ C.H. & J.S.;  No drugs or cont subs, w/ random testing w/ JS;  Def must reside w/ her father
for Bond Modification

State by Keller / Def in custody w/ Atty Vincent Rust
Rust requests reduction in bond- Risk Assessment has been done & given to parties
Keller objects to change in bond...
CRT:  I will lower the bond at this time to $5000 cash.  Given the seriousness fo this crime I do think cash is approp.  I would be happy to hear this again if circumstances change.  The conditions of the bond will remain the same
